author: The Current
description:
Watch Mt. Joy's performance of "Lucy" in studio
Support The Current: https://support.mpr.org/youtube or hit the Thanks button

Spanning the summer of 2025, Los Angeles-based band Mt. Joy have experienced what singer/guitarist Matt Quinn describes as “the best tour we've ever had.” When their tour took them to the Twin Cities, Mt. Joy visited The Current studio to play songs from a couple of their albums. Watch and listen to a performance of "Lucy" above.

Musicians
Michael Byrnes – bass
Sam Cooper – guitar
Sotiris Eliopoulos – drums
Jackie Miclau – keyboards
Matt Quinn – vocals, guitar

Credits
Guests – @MtJoyOfficial 
Host – Zach McCormick
Producer – Derrick Stevens
Video – Evan Clark
Audio – Eric Xu Romani
Graphics – Natalia Toledo
Digital Production – Reed Fischer, Luke Taylor

author: The Current
description:
Kathleen Edwards advocates for earlier start times for concerts
Support The Current: https://support.mpr.org/youtube or hit the Thanks button

Do you sometimes wish concerts started earlier? Singer-songwriter Kathleen Edwards talks about the advantages of starting shows at earlier times. "I think everyone is generally on board with it," Edwards says. Hear more of what Edwards has to say in this recent interview with Jill Riley on The Current's Morning Show.

Subscribe to our channel:
http://www.youtube.com/user/893TheCurrent?sub_confirmation=1

title: Kathleen Edwards looks at the benefits of drinking less #shorts #moderation

author: The Current
description:
Watch Jeff Tweedy and band perform "Lou Reed Was My Babysitter" in studio
Support The Current: https://support.mpr.org/youtube or hit the Thanks button

In September, Wilco frontman Jeff Tweedy released his solo triple album, Twilight Override. To support the new album, Tweedy launched a tour with a band who are very close to his heart; specifically, his sons Spencer and Sammy, and Tweedy family’s musically talented neighbors, Sima Cunningham, Liam Kazar, and Macie Stewart. “I love everybody in this band so much,” Jeff Tweedy says, “and it really does feel like an extended part of my family, and my family life, because I've known everybody since they were little kids.”

As the tour made a stop in the Twin Cities for a show at First Avenue in Minneapolis, Tweedy and his band visited The Current studio to play songs from the album. Watch a performance of "Lou Reed Was My Babysitter" above.

Musicians
Jeff Tweedy – vocals and guitar
Sammy Tweedy – vocals and keyboards / synths
Spencer Tw
title: Jeff Tweedy — Lou Reed Was My Babysitter (live for The Current)
